text: I started my day by calling some of the folks whose questions I could not get to during Monday’s Telephone Town Hall. Thank you for the thoughtful and respectful discussions. https://t.co/V8ryQ14Ut8

The American Flag is the fabric of our nation, and today, we celebrate the adoption of that Flag. Since the Second Continental Congress passed a resolution in 1777, our Flag has become the symbol of freedom and democracy worldwide. https://t.co/N9wSxp7GiA

Thank you, @DavidCookTexas, and the 4,000 people back home, for joining me in the telephone town hall last night. If you were unable to call in, or if you did and we could not get to your question, please reach out to my office. I am more than happy to answer! https://t.co/jmZ26xaEJb

Clark, you are, and always will be, remembered. https://t.co/OyJ5IT9u8u

Thank you to everyone who came by the Corsicana office today! Getting to speak directly with you is a crucial part of me doing my job in Washington. I look forward to more Coffee with your Congressman events in the coming months! https://t.co/nj3dJpw9IR

Yesterday I had the opportunity to meet with @methodistmidlo, The Salvation Army of Ellis County, and @hopeclinicec. I want to thank them for all of their work in our community. They each play a pivotal role in making our district what it is. https://t.co/iMsNu3LC5z

I had a great time in Navarro County today. Thank you, @NavarroCollege and Kohl’s for inviting me to visit. The downtown Easter Hop was an outstanding success. Thanks to all of the families that stopped by my office to get some Easter eggs! https://t.co/yCN9EMBgjz

Today, I have the opportunity to join @POTUS and @SecVetAffairs on Air Force One with my colleagues @RepVeasey and @RepColinAllred to travel back to the district to visit VA facilities in Fort Worth. During times like these, it is imperative that we support our veterans. https://t.co/59cXgjGrRS

One of my favorite duties as a Member of Congress is nominating outstanding young men and women to our nation's service academies from the 6th Congressional District. This was a highly competitive process, and I could not be prouder of what they have already accomplished. https://t.co/rA7iD4hGgY

Over the last couple of weeks, I have had the opportunity to tour and visit with many of our local law enforcement personnel. I can say, without a doubt, our district has the best law enforcement in the State of Texas. And they are all better shots than your Congressman! https://t.co/iH02ByoyWD
Battalion Chief David Maeker thank you for your incredible service and leadership in our community and to those that need it most. https://t.co/36S8OqIkmk

I had a great time touring @Airbus  in Fort Worth last week. I got to spend some time in their helicopter simulator. It turns out I can still fly! We're doing amazing things here in House District 6th. Thanks for having me! https://t.co/VN9VX1ZGII

I will never give in when it comes to opposing private interests using eminent domain to take someone’s property. Land cannot be taken, homes destroyed, and lives disrupted for a private company’s boondoggle. https://t.co/reXP8bLHil

Today was a very special day. I met 22 outstanding young men and women who want to dedicate their lives to defending our nation. In so doing, they took the last step to gain entrance to our nation's military academies. https://t.co/v1bEOg9D2D

The level of innovation I saw from the applicants from House District six was nothing short of remarkable. Congratulations to Eshan on all of his hard work and this tremendous accomplishment. https://t.co/hiikbao5aT

It was an honor to be apart of Wreaths Across America in Waxahachie yesterday. Thank you to everyone who participated across our country. This event means so much to so many people. https://t.co/7ORddx8WUT
Let’s talk a walk and talk about what happened this week in Washington. https://t.co/NDO3Ya13Ad

During nights when we have late votes at the Capitol, it’s always great to have a local leader stop by the office. Thanks, Mayor, for making the trip up to DC. You’re always welcome in my office. https://t.co/bHiphPfPcd

Today, I had the honor to be an original co-sponsor of the Microelectronics Research for Energy Innovation Act. This bill will leverage the Department of Energy’s world-leading research and development capabilities to accelerate U.S. leadership in the microelectronics industry. https://t.co/o59gdyKSFN

This week, I had the honor of meeting with State Representative Jacey Jetton, Dr. Xiqiu “Bob” Fu, Mrs. Deborah Fikes, Ran Peng, and Ruiting Renon about how to preserve and advance human rights and discussed the deadly actions of some countries destroying human rights. https://t.co/LvhwP0HjQ3

It is appropriate that on the 80th anniversary of Pearl Harbor that Congress unite and pass the NDAA. As members elected to this body, it is our duty to protect our country. With the passing of the NDAA, today we did that. https://t.co/BEhWstc1zK

Today, on the 80th anniversary of the devastating attack on Pearl Harbor, we remember the 2,403 Americans who were taken from their friends and families too soon. Today, we put aside our differences and unite to remember what makes us all Americans.
Would you take a walk with me? Let’s talk about what happened this week in Washington. https://t.co/3r5Vdw71nH

Today, House Democrats obtained quorum through the use of proxy, which I believe is unconstitutional. After staying up all night working with Leader McCarthy, I chose not to vote in protest of this destructive bill and the unconstitutional process used to pass it. https://t.co/NLMdNpkWbO
Let’s talk about what’s going on in Washington this week. https://t.co/HLhFYHGpNd

It was truly an honor to bring H.R. 5516, the VITAL Assessment Act, to the House Floor. Our veterans need our help, and we're here to answer that call. 
@CSPAN https://t.co/uWeSi4WkDN

Veteran's day is a day of celebration and remembrance of all of the things this nation stands for. 

Our veterans have sacrificed so much for our country, and I know they would do it again in a heartbeat. 

Thank you to my brothers and sisters in arms, and Happy Veteran's Day.

246 years of defending our country. 246 years of sacrificing. 246 years of holding the line. Happy Birthday, Marines. We would not be here without you. Semper Fi. I salute you. 

Here is to 246 more! https://t.co/DszqwuWcnI
Last Friday, after the longest vote in our history, Nancy Pelosi rammed through the Democrat's disastrous socialist tax and spending spree through the House. I voted NO.

Small businesses are the backbone of our country. They are the key to the American Dream. Many veterans, after their time in the service, choose to open their own business. And this week we celebrate them.
 
Let's support our veterans. Happy Veterans Small Business week!

If there is one thing Congress can agree on, it is that we need to help our veterans. I'm grateful to Chairman Takano, Ranking Member @RepBost, and my fellow committee members for unanimously voting the VITAL Assessment act for further consideration on the House Floor.

We must protect our individual freedoms. Today, I am signing on to H.R. 5360 to nullify President Biden's executive orders regarding COVID-19 mandates and to prohibit the Secretary of Labor from issuing a rule mandating vaccination against COVID-19.

Today, newly elected Ellis County Representative Brian Harrison came to visit me in Washington. I look forward to working with him on issues that impact the residents of Ellis County and the great State of Texas. https://t.co/Yu3j3nBtxy
Watching the Blue Angels with my son. Always makes me proud of our country and miss flying these exquisite aircraft. https://t.co/fkgpcPYRF7
Would you take a walk with me? Let’s talk about what happened this week in Washington. https://t.co/ZTQUmPrqnF

I want to thank everyone who came out yesterday for our new district offices' ribbon cutting and grand opening. I am blessed to have the support of all of you. Now, it's time to get to work. If you need anything, please stop by one of the offices. https://t.co/bcQ8Qh2LTb
Wearing two hats tonight. One for my Papa who passed away a year ago. One for Mark Sanders, my EOD, and USNA brother. https://t.co/fw4cnPgPzH

This year marks the 20th anniversary of the September 11th attacks on our nation. Let today be a day for those who would protest what this country is, what they think it is, be a day of remembrance and understanding of who we are. Not what they have been told we are.

Today, the Department of Defense announced that Marine Corps Lance Cpl. David L. Espinoza, 20, of Rio Bravo, Texas, was among the 13 brave men and women who gave their lives in defense of the Kabul Airport. My heart goes out to the families of these American Heroes.

Today 12 American heroes died in a suicide bombing at Kabul Airport. Biden recently said that we could trust the Taliban; the events of this morning reaffirm why we cannot. Please join me in sending prayers to the families of these warriors who made the ultimate sacrifice.

Governor Abbott just signed HB 885 which I am proud to have co-authored. Navarro College is allowed to add a baccalaureate degree in nursing to their degree offerings. This will have an incredible positive impact on Ellis County, Navarro County, DFW and surrounding areas. https://t.co/Hz9croOQnv
https://t.co/XVwtOW44yp

I attended Texas House session today, with my Republican colleagues. Doing the work on behalf of HD10. Also attended press conference calling out the Democrats dereliction of duty abandoning job and flying to DC #txlege https://t.co/1OTj6kx7EG

Tomorrow, as House District 10 State Representative, I look forward to being present for the Texas House roll call and ready to advance important conservative policies for the betterment of the people of HD 10 and all of Texas. #txlege https://t.co/RGnzHYekBD

Governor Abbott has called a special session starting July 8. Even with tremendous conservative successes as a result of regular session, looking forward to completing unfinished business for HD10 and all of Texas!  #txlege
Both laser pointers and fireworks can have grave consequences when used as a weapon. People using them as a weapon must pay a heavier penalty for their actions." #txlege

While we passed positive law enforcement reforms, I support and will continue to support enforcement. In regard to HB 2366, it hits close to home. I have mentioned before that as a pilot I have been lased and it damages eye sight and obstructs vision. #txlege

I am proud to have co-authored and passed HB 2622 to make Texas a 2nd Amendment Sanctuary State. Texas will NOT enforce any federal order or law that infringes on the right to keep and bear arms. #txlege https://t.co/QbrklhW4G8

Faith is essential in many Texans lives. That's why I Co-Authored for #HB525 to designate houses of worship as "essential" in state law. No government official can ever use the law to close the doors to people of faith. #txlege

HB 3, the Texas Pandemic Disaster Act, passed out of the Texas House. The bill clarifies government emergency powers and limitations during a pandemic disaster. HB 3 protects Texans' constitutional rights & ensures a streamlined & effective response to a future pandemic. #txlege https://t.co/HRABBVQzYr
Proud Co-Author of HB 1195. Protecting Texas small businesses and other businesses for unnecessary taxes #txlege

I am proud to Co-Sponsor SB 1776 which provides for inclusion of an elective course on the founding principles of the United States in the curriculum for public high school students and the posting of the founding documents of the United States in public school buildings #txlege https://t.co/3Ldn3eTxnV
https://t.co/hHItoql7qA
Sexual Assault Awareness Month, April 2021. Proud to have voted YES on every bill fulfilling EVERY recommendation made by the Sexual Assault Survivors’ Task Force. #txlege https://t.co/NGX6oJkQI6

I am proud to have Co-Authored HB 1900 creating financial consequences for cities defunding the police. Defunding the police will put citizens and other officers in danger. I believe in working together for positive reform but defunding is not the correct approach. 

#txlege

I am continuing to fight for TEXAN'S 2nd Amendment rights by co-authoring HB 2622. This helps make Texas a 2nd-Amendment Sanctuary State. No state resources can be used to enforce federal firearms laws that are not also state laws. 

#txlege
@MidloMirror @WaxahachieNews @startelegram

I’m committed to helping secure the border. Biden-Harris failing. Texas stepping up. I voted to fund $797 million for border security purposes at DPS & 8 other state agencies. Border security funding supports DPS personnel at full deployment levels. #txlege #securetheborder

Pleased to support #TexasHouse budget. Passed unanimously. It is a  conservative budget. There is no Medicaid expansion. Supports school choice, charter schools. Keeps promises to students and teachers. Continues property tax relief #txlege
Happy Resurrection Sunday! Here's to a blessed time with your friends, family, and loved ones.
A Texas DPS Trooper, Chad Walker, is in critical condition after being shot outside of Mexia. Please keep Trooper Walker and his family in your prayers.
